questions.text: All of the following are true about ‘Evidence-based medicine’ except:

options.label: A
options.text: Aims to apply best available evidence gained from scientific method to clinical decision making

options.label: B
options.text: Research paper is investigated by the tools quoted in research paper itself to check validity

options.label: C
options.text: Opinions of medical professionals & researchers have been given least importance

options.label: D
options.text: Evidence is generated from weak & poor studies

questions.correct_answer: D. Evidence is generated from weak & poor studies

questions.text: Hypothesis is a:

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: National population is always taken as the standard population

options.label: C
options.text: For direct Standardization, age specific rates of study population are applied to that of standard population

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: B. National population is always taken as the standard population

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: C. Killing power of a disease with no time interval

questions.text: Estimating the burden of particular disease in a community is measured by:

options.label: B
options.text: Population at risk in that particular area

options.label: D
options.text: Attributable deaths of a particular disease

questions.correct_answer: C. Total deaths in that year

questions.text: Age specific death rate can be used for all of the following except

options.label: A
options.text: Identify specific age groups at risk for preventive action

options.label: B
options.text: Comparison for different causes within same population

options.label: C
options.text: Comparison between different sexes in relation to injuries and accidents

options.label: D
options.text: Comparison between different age groups in relation to injuries and accidents

questions.correct_answer: C. Comparison between different sexes in relation to injuries and accidents

options.label: B

questions.text: Which of the following statement is not true ?

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence decreases when a programme is effective

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence implies number of new cases detected over a fixed time

options.label: C
options.text: Vaccination strategies decreases the incidence of a disease

options.label: D
options.text: Effective treatment modalities for non communicable disease will decrease incidence

questions.correct_answer: D. Effective treatment modalities for non communicable disease will decrease incidence

questions.text: If a new effective treatment for cancer is initiated and all factor remain same , which of the following is most likely to happen.

A diagnostic test has been introduced that will detect a certain disease 1 yrs earlier than it is usually detected. Which of the following is most likely to happen to the disease within the 10 yrs after the test its introduced? (Assumed that early detection has no effect on the natural history of the disease. Also assume that no changes in death certification practices occur during the 10yrs.):

options.label: A
options.text: The period prevalence rate will decrease

options.label: B
options.text: The apparent 5 yr survival rate will increase

options.label: C
options.text: The age adjusted mortality rate will decrease

questions.correct_answer: B. The apparent 5 yr survival rate will increase

questions.text: If the prevalence is very low as compared to the incidence for adisease, it implies:

options.label: A
options.text: Disease is very fatal and / or easily curable

options.label: C
options.text: Calculation of prevalence & incidence is wrong

options.label: D
options.text: Nothing can be said, as they are independent

questions.correct_answer: A. Disease is very fatal and / or easily curable

questions.text: Prevalence of a disease all are true except:

options.label: A
options.text: Is the best measure of disease burden in etiological studies

options.label: B
options.text: Can only be determined by a cross section study

options.label: C
options.text: Is the number of new cases in a defined population

options.label: D
options.text: Describes the balance between incidence, mortality and recovery

questions.correct_answer: C. Is the number of new cases in a defined population

questions.text: The relationship between incidence and prevalence can be expresses as:

options.label: A
options.text: The product of incidence and mean duration of disease

options.label: B
options.text: The dividend of incidence and mean duration of disease

options.label: C
options.text: The sum of incidence and mean duration of disease

options.label: D
options.text: The difference of incidence of mean duration of disease

questions.correct_answer: A. The product of incidence and mean duration of disease

questions.text: All the following are true in a randomized control trial (RCT) except :-

options.label: A
options.text: Baseline characteristics of intervention are similar in both arms

options.label: B
options.text: Investigator’s bias is minimized by double blinding

options.label: C
options.text: The sample size required depends on the hypothesis

options.label: D
options.text: The dropouts from the trial should be excluded from the analysis

questions.correct_answer: D. The dropouts from the trial should be excluded from the analysis

questions.text: What is the purpose of a control group in an experimental study?

options.label: A
options.text: Its permit an ethical alternative for patients who do not wish to be subjected to an experimental treatment.

options.label: B
options.text: It allows larger numbers of patients to be used, thus increasing the power of the statistical techniques used

options.label: C
options.text: It helps to eliminate alternative explanations for the results of the study

options.label: D
options.text: It reduces the likelihood of making a type II error in hypothesis testing

questions.correct_answer: C. It helps to eliminate alternative explanations for the results of the study

questions.text: What is the purpose of randomization in a clinical trial?

options.label: A
options.text: To equalize the effects of extraneous variables, thus guarding against bias

options.label: B
options.text: To allow inferential statistics to be used

questions.correct_answer: A. To equalize the effects of extraneous variables, thus guarding against bias

questions.text: A pharmaceutical company develops a new antihypertensive drug. Samples of 24 hypertensive patients, randomly selected from a large population of hypertensive people, are randomly divided into 2 groups of 12. One group is given the new drug over a period of 1 month; the other group is given a placebo according to the same schedule. Neither the patients nor the treating physicians are aware of which patients are in which group. At the end of the month, measurements are made of the patient’s blood pressures. This study:
Intention- to- treat analysis is done in
The major purpose of random assignment in a clinical trial is to :

options.label: A
options.text: Help ensure that study subjects are representative of the general population

options.label: D
options.text: Ensure that the study groups are comparable on base line characteristics

questions.correct_answer: D. Ensure that the study groups are comparable on base line characteristics

questions.text: Which one of the following statements regarding pre post clinical trial is most appropriate?

options.label: B
options.text: They are useful in studies involving mortality

options.label: C
options.text: They use the patient as his or her own control

options.label: D
options.text: They are usually easier to interpret than the comparable parallel clinical trial

questions.correct_answer: C. They use the patient as his or her own control

questions.text: Selection bias can be eliminated by:

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Person or groups being observed is blind about the study

options.label: C
options.text: Both observer and person or group being observed is blind about the study

options.label: D
options.text: Interpreters and analyser are blind about the study

questions.correct_answer: C. Both observer and person or group being observed is blind about the study

questions.text: All are true regarding meta-analysis except:

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.text: An advertisement in a medical journal stated that 2000 subjects with sore throat were treated with our new medicine. With in 4 days, 94 % were asymptomatic. The advertisement claims that the medicine was effective. Based on the evidence given above, the claim:

options.label: B
options.text: May be incorrect as the conclusion is not based on a rate

options.label: C
options.text: May be incorrect because of failure to recognize a long – term cohort effect

options.text: Incorrect because as no control or comparison group was involved

questions.correct_answer: D. Incorrect because as no control or comparison group was involved
